seq.help.snippets.digest: Overview of seq's snippets - pre-built bits of patch to help make your patching faster.

seq.help.modules.digest: All about seq's modules, which are complete UI and preset-enabled versions of the seq objects.

seq.help.signalflow.digest: An intro to how signals work in seq.

seq.ex.feel.digest: An example that uses seq.feel~ to create a loose groove.

seq.ex.mc.digest: A multi-track sequencing example made with the MC version of seq~ objects.

seq.ex.sometimes-retrig.digest: Combines seq.retrig~ and seq.rprob~ to play back a pattern with occasional ratcheting.

seq.ex.traverse.digest: Uses advanced features of seq.counter~ to navigate a melodic pattern.

seq.ex.seqtwist.digest: seq objects hanging out with some of their best friends

seq.ex.nestedtuplets.digest: Irregular rhythms built from unusual subdivisions

seq.ex.quantized.digest: Quantize incoming MIDI notes with seq.loop~ and seq.onepulse~

seq.ex.livesync.digest: Sync a sequencer with Ableton Live

seq.ex.modwheelretrig.digest: Trigger and modulate ratchets with the keyboard and mod wheel.

seq.ex.subdivratchet.digest: Create ratcheted rhythms with a cascade of subdivisions.

seq.xtra.fluidslice.digest: Generate a list of slice points for the seq.dsp.simplesampler device used in the MC and subdiv ratchet examples. Uses the FluCoMa package.

seq.xtra.img2pattern.digest: Ingests an image and produces a pattern.

seq.xtra.linkbar.digest: Clock similar to seq.bar~ and seq.clock~ that stays in sync with Ableton Live using Ableton Link. Uses the link package.

seq.xtra.patterndisplay.digest: Visualize pattern playback in a Jitter matrix. Works with regular and MC signals.

seq.xtra.pattrhelper.digest: Used in the seq.pattrpresets snippet to make prest setup easy in a patch using seq modules or snippets.

seq.xtra.stepgridviewer.digest: Single-channel pattern playback visualizer based on live.grid.

seq.xtra.rnboexternal.digest: Demonstration of how the seq externals were made with RNBO.

seq.ex.transpose.digest: Create evolving melodies by transposing one sequence with another.
